headline: Why a Long Bear Market Wouldn't Be All Bad
summary: 66 months That's how long it took the S&P to regain its previous high following the 2007-2009 selloff. In today's column I look at why downturns like this can be both awful—and therapeutic. On the positive side, they discredit the faded boom’s cheerleaders, offer solid bargains to long-term investors near the bottom, and remind us what capital markets are for: matching mostly good businesses with patient savers’ nest eggs.
